alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 18 at 11:26AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Doney Park and far northeast Flagstaff in Coconino County. * WHEN...Until 230 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1124 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... San Francisco Wash. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience minor flooding include... Flagstaff, Hutchison Acres, Doney Park, Timberline and Little Elden Spring Horse Camp. - This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 420 and 427. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
